Tossup Questions.Text: Express 600º in radians as a reduced fraction
Pitchblende is one of the main ores of what element?
Find the center of the circle given by the following equation:  x2 + y2 + 4x + 16y + 3 = 0
For the function xxf1)(, what is '(5)f(read as: f prime of 5)?
Giving your answer in decimal form, what would the Z value be if a distant celestial object were shifted towards longer wavelengths by 40% of the original wavelength?
Name all of the following 3 choices that are chemoautotrophs: Nitrosomonas (read as: nitro-so-MOAN-us)  Paramecium;  Volvox
Name all of the following 3 concentration units that are temperature-dependent:  molal (read as: moe-LAHL);  molarity;  normality
What was the most sensitive device Coulomb used to measure the electric forces between pith balls?
What is the most common name for the histone octamer used in the coiling and packing of DNA and regulation of gene expression?
What is the common name for the 27-carbon lipid whose synthesis is in part regulated by HMG CoA (read as: H, M, G, koh, A) reductase and is the basic starting point for estrogen synthesis?
Which of the following BEST describes the Balmer series:
Tossup Questions.W: a series of quantum numbers indicating certain energy levels
Tossup Questions.Y: a sequence of elements that are produced chronologically in supernovae
Tossup Questions.Z: the energy spectrum of the early universe
Tossup Questions.Answer: X)  HYDROGEN ATOM SPECTRAL LINE EMISSION

Tossup Questions.Text: Which of the following is the single most important factor that generally sets a northern limit to tree growth, such as in the areas of transition between taiga and tundra in Alaska:
The BEST explanation of why population I (read as: one) stars have a higher proportion of elements heavier than helium than population II ( read as: two) stars, is because Population I stars are:
Tossup Questions.Y: usually closer to planetary nebula than population II stars
Tossup Questions.Z: often found near H-I (read as: H, one) regions
Tossup Questions.Answer: W)  YOUNGER THAN POPULATION II STARS

Tossup Questions.Text: Which of the following is NOT true of globular proteins in mammals:
Tossup Questions.X: some serve as transport molecules in the plasma
Tossup Questions.Y: plasma enzymes typically have an optimal operating pH of about 6.8 to 7.0
Tossup Questions.Answer: Y)  PLASMA ENZYMES TYPICALLY HAVE AN OPTIMAL OPERATING PH OF ABOUT 6.8 TO 7.0

Tossup Questions.Text: Which of the following is a substance whose molecular and empirical formulas are NOT the same:
Which of the following has the lowest refractive index at STP:
Which of the following is a fine-grained silica-rich sedimentary rock that is made primarily of microcrystalline quartz:
The largest deposits of diatomite, or diatomaceous earth, are typically found in which of the following regions of the U.S.:
Tossup Questions.Answer: W)  WESTERN  (Solution: most formed in shallow lakes and marine environments)

Tossup Questions.Text: Which of the following is closest to the range for the Balmer series:
Which of the following is most directly responsible for the colloid osmotic pressure in humans that acts to retain fluid in the vascular system:
An organic compound with the formula C6H14 is an:
Which of the following did J. J. Thompson use that primarily led him to conclude that electrons were basic particles of atoms and carried electric charge:
Meteorologists think of wind as circulation patterns which are divided into 4 scales of motion.  A land-breeze circulation is grouped into which of the following categories:
Which of the following anthropogenic air pollutants is the major contributor to reduced visibility in most regions of the U.S., excluding fires and dust:
Which of the following has a melting point of 185ºC and readily dissolves in water at room temperature, but is NOT an electrolyte:

Bonus Questions.Text: According to the Standard Model of Particle Physics, through what force would the top quark decay?
Bonus Questions.Answer: WEAK FORCE  (ACCEPT:  WEAK or WEAK INTERACTION)

Bonus Questions.Text: Giving your answers in tefind the total surface area of a closed right circular cone whose altitude is 8 inches and radius is 6 inches:
Bonus Questions.Answer: 96  (Solution: l2 = 82 + 62, l = 10 in;  LSl S2 in2)      High School   Round 13     Page 3

Bonus Questions.Text: Order the following 3 temperature values from the COOLEST to the WARMEST:  32ºC;  85ºF;  310 K
Bonus Questions.Answer: 85ºF;  32ºC;  310 K      High School   Round 13     Page 4

Bonus Questions.Text: How many sidereal minutes are in 7.5 sidereal hours?
During photorespiration, the plant enzyme RuBisCO (read as: rue-BIS-ko) will bind what molecular substance rather than carbon dioxide?
Bonus Questions.Answer: OXYGEN  (ACCEPT:  O2)      High School   Round 13     Page 5

Bonus Questions.Text: Rounded to the nearest hundred joules, how much work is done in pulling a sled across a pond for 3 meters with 100 newtons of force, with a rope that makes a 45º angle with the pond?
Bonus Questions.Answer: 200   (Solution:  w = F × d × cos angle = 100N × 3 m × 0.7071 = 212.13)      High School   Round 13     Page 6

Bonus Questions.Text: What are the coordinates of the vertex in the graph of the following equation:  y = 4x2 + 8x  5
Choosing from upper right, lower right, lower left, and upper left, in what area of the Hertzsprung Russell diagram will the Sun end its life?
Bonus Questions.Answer: LOWER LEFT      High School   Round 13     Page 8

Bonus Questions.Text: Consider a satellite that is a uniform sphere rotating about its axis.  What is its moment of inertia, giving your answer in scientific notation and in kilogram meters squared, if it has a mass of 10,000 kilograms and a diameter of 200 meters?
An object is launched straight up from the ground with an initial velocity of 176 feet per second.  What is the height of the object above the ground, in feet, 2 seconds into the flight?
Bonus Questions.Answer: 288  (Solution:  P(t) = -16t2 + 176t;  P(2) = -16(4) + 352 = 288 ft)      High School   Round 13     Page 10

Bonus Questions.Text: What is the most common name for the edible vegetable oil that is derived from cultivars of rapeseed plants and is low in erucic acid?
Bonus Questions.Answer: CANOLA OIL  (ACCEPT:  CANOLA)      High School   Round 13     Page 11

Bonus Questions.Text: If a planet had an orbital period of 11.2 years, what is the length of its orbital semi-major axis, in astronomical units rounded to the nearest whole number?
From what vitamin is the electron carrier FAD (read as: F, A, D) derived?
Bonus Questions.Answer: RIBOFLAVIN  (ACCEPT:  VITAMIN B2)      High School   Round 13     Page 12

Bonus Questions.Text: Calculate the enthalpy of vaporization, in kilojoules, of water at 25ºC and 1 atmosphere.  Assume the standard enthalpy of formation of liquid water is 286 kilojoules and the standard enthalpy of formation of water gas is 242 kilojoules:
Bonus Questions.Answer: 44  (Solution:  reaction pf°(products)  rf°(reactants) = [242  (286) = +44.0 kJ)

Bonus Questions.Text: Order the following 3 choices from the MOST penetrating through a thin sheet of cardboard to the LEAST:  beta rays;  alpha rays;  x-rays
Bonus Questions.Answer: X-RAYS;  BETA RAYS;  ALPHA RAYS      High School   Round 13     Page 13

Bonus Questions.Text: Name all of the following 4 organelles that are bounded by a double membrane:  nucleus;  mitochondrion;  lysosome;  chloroplast
Bonus Questions.Answer: NUCLEUS;  MITOCHONDRION;  CHLOROPLAST (ACCEPT:  ALL BUT LYSOSOME)         High School   Round 13     Page 1   ROUND 13

Bonus Questions.Text: Give the systematic chemical name for the following ionic compound:  Cr2(SeO4)3
Bonus Questions.Answer: CHROMIUM(III) SELENA

Bonus Questions.Text: Which of the following is NOT true of an El Nino:
Bonus Questions.W: when an El Nino is present, fish are less abundant off the west coast of South America
Bonus Questions.X: El Ninos typically come along every 4 to 5 years
Bonus Questions.Y: during a peak El Nino, strong high pressure will be present in the eastern Pacific with lower pressure to the west
Bonus Questions.Z: El Nino affects global weather patterns
Bonus Questions.Answer: Y)  DURING A PEAK EL NINO, STRONG HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE PRESENT IN THE EASTERN PACIFIC WITH LOWER PRESSURE TO THE WEST  (Solution: during peak strong high pressure is in the western Pacific with lower pressure to the east, setting up an easterly wind flow)

Bonus Questions.Text: Which of the following is a molecule with a square pyramidal molecular geometry around its central atom:
Bonus Questions.Answer: X)  ClF5  (Solution: PCl5 = trigonal bipyramidal; XeF4 = square planar;  SF6 = octahedral)

Bonus Questions.Text: Which of the following is a foliated metamorphic rock composed of very fine-grained mica:
Bonus Questions.Answer: X)  PHYLLITE  (Solution: marble = non-foliated; quartzit-foliated;  schist = well-developed foliation)      High School   Round 13     Page 7

Bonus Questions.Text: Diatomite, or diatomaceous earth, is readily available in the U.S. and is used primarily for which of the following functions:
Bonus Questions.Answer: Y)  FILTERING AGENT

Bonus Questions.Text: Which of the following is NOT true of the most common form of DNA:
Bonus Questions.X: it has 3.4 nanometers between each successive nucleotide base of the same strand
Bonus Questions.Z: each strand has a 3-prime phosphate and a 5-prime hydroxyl at opposite ends
Bonus Questions.Answer: Z)  EACH STRAND HAS A 3-PRIME PHOSPHATE AND A 5-PRIME HYDROXYL AT OPPOSITE ENDS

Bonus Questions.Text: Which of the following gases has the highest effusion rate through a pinhole opening from one compartment to another and at room temperature:
Bonus Questions.Answer: Z)  HELIUM      High School   Round 13     Page 9

Bonus Questions.Text: If the air temperature is 0ºF and the wind speed is 10 miles per hour, which of the following is closest to the wind chill, in degrees Fahrenheit:
Which of the following is NOT true regarding ribosomes:
Bonus Questions.W: they are about 20 nanometers in diameter
Bonus Questions.X: eukaryotic ribosomes are slightly larger than prokaryotic ribosomes
Bonus Questions.Y: mitochondrial ribosomes have 40S  (read as: forty S) small subunits
Bonus Questions.Answer: Y)  MITOCHONDRIAL RIBOSOMES HAVE 40S SMALL SUBUNITS
